Label: LABEL
Definition: A definition

Label: administering substance in vivo
Definition: A planned process by which a material is intentionally given to an organism resulting in exposure of the organism to that substance.
Mapping Note: We intend to map this term to OBI:0600007

Label: solid tissue transplantation
Definition: A planned process in which solid tissue is transferred to an organism.
Example of Usage: The process of surgically attaching a donor kidney into a recipient patient.

Label: transfusion
Definition: A planned process in which a bodily fluid is transferred into an organism.
Example of Usage: The process of administering donated blood into a recipient patient.

Label: vaccination
Definition: Administering a vaccine to an organism with the intention of inducing immunity against antigen components of the vaccine.
Example of Usage: Administeration of the annual flu vacccine to a human subject.

Label: documented exposure without evidence for disease
Definition: A process in which an organism is exposed to a substance which is evident from process having been observed or documented.
Example of Usage: A restaurant worker tests positive for presence of Norovirus, but experiences no symptoms of illness.

Label: environmental exposure to endemic/ubiquitous agent without evidence for disease
Definition: A process in which an organism's exposure to a material entity is assumed from that material being commonly present in the environment of the organism.
Example of Usage: Exposure of a human to Timothy grass pollen in an area where it is known to be common during pollen season without experiencing any allergic symptoms.

Label: exposure to substance without evidence for disease
Definition: An unplanned process in which an organism comes into contact with a substance without evidence for a disease caused by that exposure.
Example of Usage: Exposure of a human to Timothy grass pollen without any allergic symptoms.

Label: exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease
Definition: A process in which an organism is exposed to a material entity which is evident by a detectable immune reactivity against it.
Example of Usage: A restaurant worker tests positive for presence of Norovirus, but experiences no symptoms of illness.
Mapping Note: We intend to map this term to OBI:1110061.

Label: occurrence of asymptomatic infection
Definition: A process in which an infectious agent is in or on the body of an organism without causing detectable disease.
Example of Usage: A restaurant worker tests positive for presence of Norovirus, but experiences no symptoms of illness.

Label: infectious challenge
Definition: Administering an infectious agent to an organism in order to test if and how an infection will occurr
Example of Usage: Administration of Leishmania major into Balb/c mice after they were immunized with a peptide vaccine in order to test if the vaccine results in less disease symptoms when compared to mice who did not receive the vaccine.
Mapping Note: We intend to map this term to OBI:0000712.

Label: occurrence of autoimmune disease
Definition: The process in which an autoimmune disease unfolds.
Example of Usage: The process of developing increasingly severe joint swelling, pain and disfigurement as rheumatoid arthritis affects a patient.
Mapping Note: We intend to map this term to OBI:1110054.

Label: occurrence of allergy
Definition: The process in which an allergic disease unfolds.
Example of Usage: The process of developing hives after eating shrimp.
Mapping Note: We intend to map this term to OBI:1110012.

Label: occurrence of cancer
Definition: The process in which cancer unfolds
Example of Usage: The process of developing a cough and difficulty breathing as a tumor grows in the airway of a lung cancer patient.
Mapping Note: We intend to map this term to OBI:1110053.

Label: occurrence of cancer associated with virus
Definition: An occurence of cancer where there is evidence for the presence of a cancer causing oncovirus in the tumor.
Example of Usage: The process of human T-lymphotropic virus replicating in a subject prior to their development of adult T-cell leukemia/lymphoma.

Label: occurrence of disease
Definition: The process in which a disease unfolds.
Mapping Note: We intend to map this term to OGMS:0000063.

Label: occurrence of infectious disease
Definition: The process in which an infectious disease unfolds.
Example of Usage: The process of developing fever, chills, and congestion after being infected with influenza A virus.
Mapping Note: We intend to map this term to OBI:1110008.

Label: post disease course
Definition: A disease course that has ended.

Label: unknown disease course
Definition: A disease course whose status is currently unknown.

Label: other disease course
Definition: A disease course that cannot be described by existing disease course stages.

Label: transplantation or transfusion
Definition: Transfering a solid tissue (transplant) or bodily fluid (transfusion) to an organism.
Example of Usage: The process of surgically attaching a donor kidney into a recipient patient.
Mapping Note: We intend to map this term to OBI:0000105.

Label: unknown
Definition: An organism's lifespan for which there is no available information on an exposure to a material entity of interest.
Example of Usage: The lack of information regarding if a human has ever lived in or visted an area where Dengue virus is common.

Label: no exposure
Definition: An organism's lifspan which does not include exposure to a substance of interest.
Example of Usage: The information that a human has never lived in nor visted an area where Dengue virus is common.
